academy.subtitle: Level up your agency with enterprise-grade digital sales training.

c1.title: Mastering LinkedIn for Insurance
c1.desc: Optimize your profile to attract high-value commercial clients.

sections.title: Why LinkedIn Matters
sections.body:
LinkedIn is not just a CV repository; it is the #1 B2B lead generation platform. For insurance agents, it offers a unique opportunity to connect with business owners and decision-makers. 

A professional presence here signals authority and trust before you even send a message.

sections.title: Profile Optimization Checklist
sections.body:
1. Headline: Don't just say 'Insurance Agent'. Use 'Risk Advisor for SMBs' or 'Protecting Families'.
2. Photo: Use the AI Headshot tool in this dashboard to get a professional look.
3. About Section: Write in the first person. Tell a story about *why* you help people, not just *what* you sell.
4. Featured Section: Upload case studies or client testimonials.

sections.title: Engagement Strategy
sections.body:
Spend 10 minutes a day commenting on posts by your target prospects. Do not pitch immediately. Add value to the conversation. 

Example: If a business owner posts about expansion, comment 'Congratulations! Exciting growth. Hope the new premises serves you well.'.

c2.title: The Art of Digital Follow-up
c2.desc: Perfecting your email and SMS cadence to convert leads without spamming.

sections.title: The Speed to Lead
sections.body:
Statistics show that contacting a lead within 5 minutes increases conversion rates by 900%. 

Use the automation rules in AgentOS to send an immediate SMS acknowledgement while you prepare to call.

sections.title: The 5-Touch Rule
sections.body:
Most sales happen after the 5th follow-up. 

Day 1: Call + SMS + Email.
Day 2: Email (Value add, e.g., an article).
Day 3: Call (Leave voicemail).
Day 5: SMS (Soft check-in).
Day 7: Breakup Email ('Should I close this file?').

sections.title: Multi-Channel Approach
sections.body: Don't rely on just one channel. If they don't answer the phone, they might reply to a WhatsApp. Mix your methods to find their preferred communication style.

c3.title: Video Marketing 101
c3.desc: Build trust instantly using short-form video on Instagram and TikTok.

sections.title: Why Video?
sections.body: Video builds trust faster than text. People buy from people they feel they know. A 30-second video explaining a policy clause can save hours of explaining later.

sections.title: Simple Content Ideas
sections.body:
1. 'Did you know?' series: Quick facts about coverage.
2. 'Day in the life': Show the human side of your agency.
3. Client Success Stories (with permission): How a claim was handled smoothly.

sections.title: Technical Basics
sections.body:
You don't need a studio. 
- Good lighting (face a window).
- Clear audio (use headphones with a mic).
- Stable camera (prop up your phone).

 Authenticity wins over production value.

c4.title: Digital Compliance Essentials
c4.desc: Navigating regulatory requirements when posting online.

sections.title: The Golden Rule
sections.body: Never promise outcomes you cannot guarantee. Avoid words like 'Always', 'Cheapest', 'Best', or 'Guaranteed Returns'.

sections.title: Disclaimers
sections.body:
Always include a link to your official privacy policy and terms of service in your bio or post footer. 

When discussing investment-linked products, standard risk warnings are mandatory.

sections.title: Data Privacy
sections.body: Never share client names or identifiable details in social posts without explicit written consent. Even 'My client John from Athens' can be too revealing.

c5.title: From Like to Lead
c5.desc: Strategies to turn social media engagement into bindable quotes.

sections.title: The Direct Message (DM) Strategy
sections.body:
If someone likes your post about 'New Parent Life Insurance', don't just leave it. 

Send a DM: 'Thanks for the love on the post! Are you exploring options for your family, or just browsing?' 
Keep it low pressure.

sections.title: Lead Magnets
sections.body:
Create a simple PDF checklist (e.g., 'Home Safety Checklist'). Offer it for free in exchange for an email address. 

Use the Microsite Builder to create a landing page for this.

c6.title: Personal Branding for Agents
c6.desc: How to differentiate yourself from direct writers and aggregators.

sections.title: Your Unique Value Proposition
sections.body:
You are not selling a policy; you are selling peace of mind and your expertise. 

Why should they choose YOU over a faceless website? 
Answer: You advocate for them during a claim.

sections.title: Visual Consistency
sections.body: Use the same headshot across LinkedIn, WhatsApp, and email. Use consistent colors in your posts. This builds subconscious recognition.

c7.title: AI for Content Creation
c7.desc: Leveraging GenAI to write posts, emails, and scripts 10x faster.

sections.title: Prompt Engineering Basics
sections.body:
Be specific. Instead of 'Write a post about car insurance', try: 
'Write a funny, empathetic Instagram caption about a flat tire on a rainy Tuesday, reminding people about Roadside Assistance coverage.'

sections.title: Using AgentOS Tools
sections.body:
Use the Social Composer in this dashboard. It has pre-built AI prompts tuned for insurance compliance and engagement. 

Always review AI output before posting.

c8.title: Handling Price Objections
c8.desc: Scripts and techniques for value-based selling in chat/messenger.

sections.title: The 'Apples to Apples' Trap
sections.body:
When a client says 'I found it cheaper online', do not drop your price immediately. 

Ask: 'Does that cheaper quote include glass breakage and legal protection? Let's compare the fine print so you know what you are *not* getting.'

sections.title: The Value Pivot
sections.body:
Shift the conversation from Cost to Value. 

'For only â‚¬5 more per month, you get a dedicated agent (me) who will handle the paperwork if you crash. Is your time worth more than â‚¬5?'

c9.title: Automated Cross-Selling
c9.desc: Setting up email workflows to round out accounts automatically.

sections.title: The Best Lead is a Current Client
sections.body:
It is 5x cheaper to retain a client than get a new one. 

If they have Auto, they likely rent or own a home. If they have a business, they have liability needs.

sections.title: Trigger Events
sections.body:
Set up automation rules: 
- 3 months after Auto policy start: Send 'Home Insurance Discount' email.
- Client birthday: Send greeting + 'Life Insurance Review' offer.

c10.title: Local SEO Mastery
c10.desc: Dominating Google Maps to drive local foot traffic and calls.

sections.title: Google Business Profile
sections.body:
This is your digital storefront. Ensure your hours are correct. Upload photos of your office and team. 

Respond to EVERY review, positive or negative.

sections.title: Getting Reviews
sections.body:
After every policy issuance, ask: 'If you were happy with my service, would you mind leaving a 5-star review? It helps my small business grow.' 

Send the direct link.

sections.title: Local Keywords
sections.body: In your website bio, mention your city and neighborhood. 'Insurance Agent in Glyfada' helps you rank when locals search 'insurance near me'.
